failed_checks.rule_description: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.
failed_checks.impact: Without VPC flow logs, you risk not having enough information about network traffic flow to investigate incidents or identify security issues.
failed_checks.resolution: Enable flow logs for VPC
failed_checks.description: VPC Flow Logs is not enabled for VPC

failed_checks.rule_description: VPC Flow Logs is a feature that enables you to capture information about the IP traffic going to and from network interfaces in your VPC. After you've created a flow log, you can view and retrieve its data in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. It is recommended that VPC Flow Logs be enabled for packet "Rejects" for VPCs.
failed_checks.impact: Without VPC flow logs, you risk not having enough information about network traffic flow to investigate incidents or identify security issues.
failed_checks.resolution: Enable flow logs for VPC

failed_checks.rule_description: Load balancers should drop invalid headers
